triples.name: Quantum complexity theory
triples.relevance: The paper studies quantum complexity in chaotic systems as its central topic.

triples.name: Time evolution
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes how quantum systems evolve over time under chaotic Hamiltonians.

triples.name: Hamiltonian mechanics
triples.relevance: The paper examines time evolution under chaotic Hamiltonian operators.

triples.name: Sachdev-Ye-Kitaev model
triples.relevance: The SYK model serves as the main example system for studying quantum complexity in large-N chaotic theories.

triples.name: Chaos theory
triples.relevance: The paper focuses specifically on quantum complexity in chaotic systems and chaotic Hamiltonians.

triples.name: Unitary operator
triples.relevance: The paper studies geodesics on manifolds of unitary operators that describe quantum time evolution.

triples.name: Hilbert space
triples.relevance: Unitary operators act on Hilbert space, the fundamental mathematical framework of quantum mechanics.

triples.name: Geodesic
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates that quantum complexity is related to lengths of minimal geodesics on unitary manifolds.

triples.name: Euler-Arnold equation
triples.relevance: The Euler-Arnold formalism is used to analyze geodesics and demonstrate linear complexity growth.

triples.name: Stationary state
triples.relevance: Energy eigenstates, which are stationary states, are analyzed in the context of quantum complexity.

triples.name: Eigenstate thermalization hypothesis
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes eigenstate projectors and proposes ECH related to understanding energy eigenstate structure.

triples.name: Holographic principle
triples.relevance: Holographic duality is referenced in discussing expected quantum complexity behavior in chaotic systems.

triples.name: PSPACE
triples.relevance: The paper discusses implications for the hypothesized complexity class separation PSPACE â‰  BQP/poly.

triples.name: BQP
triples.relevance: BQP/poly is referenced as a quantum complexity class in the context of proposed computational complexity separations.

triples.name: Eigenstate
triples.relevance: The paper introduces the Eigenstate Complexity Hypothesis (ECH) to bound overlaps between eigenstate projectors and k-local operators.
